title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Musk, in a cryptic tweet, hinted at the prospect of launching a tender offer to acquire Twitter.

U.S. home prices soared 15% to a record in March while mortgage rates continued to rise rapidly, slowing home sales.

U.S. stock indexes ended mixed, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq losing 0.06% and 1.2%, respectively, and the Dow adding 0.7%.

P&G posted its biggest quarterly sales gain in decades, but executives warned that shoppers may begin to balk at rising prices.

Carvana, a pandemic star that has suffered during the recovery, reported its first-ever drop in quarterly sales and said it would raise capital.

Just Eat is considering selling Grubhub after the subsidiary posted a decline in orders following a boom in sales during Covid lockdowns.

United Airlines reported a loss but said it would return to profitability in the current quarter and for the year.

Icahn is urging BlackRock and others to support his proxy fight at McDonald's for better treatment of pregnant pigs.

What's News: Business & Finance
